intro: Mentha intermedia, commonly known as field mint, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or white, arranged in whorls along the stem. Its aromatic leaves contain essential oils, which contribute to its distinctive minty scent and various medicinal properties. Mentha intermedia is often used in traditional medicine and as a flavoring agent in culinary applications.
